info.name: Lateral cuneate nucleus
info.description: The lateral cuneate nucleus is AKA the accessory cuneate nucleus. Located in the medulla, lateral to the cuneate nucleus, it receives proprioceptive input from the ipsilateral upper extremity via the cuneate fasciculus. The neurons in this nucleus are the origin of the cuneocerebellar tract that carries this proprioceptive information to the ipsilateral side of the cerebellum.
